This property contains a printer name that is suitable for display in your app’s user interface. For printers you create yourself using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinter/init(url:)] method, the value of this property is `nil` until you successfully connect to the printer using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinter/contactPrinter(_:)] method.

# displayName

**Instance Property**

The human-readable printer name.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var displayName: String { get }
```

## Discussion

This property contains a printer name that is suitable for display in your app’s user interface. For printers you create yourself using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinter/init(url:)] method, the value of this property is `nil` until you successfully connect to the printer using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinter/contactPrinter(_:)] method.

## Getting the printer information

- **displayLocation**: The human-readable text that describes the location of the printer.
- **makeAndModel**: A string that contains the manufacturer’s name and the model name of the printer.
- **supportedJobTypes**: The capabilities of the printer.
- **UIPrinter.JobTypes**: Constants that indicate the types of jobs that the printer supports.
- **supportsColor**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the printer supports color printing.
- **supportsDuplex**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the printer supports printing on both sides of a sheet of paper.
